answers.answer: This is a diabetes board. Do you have a question about diabetes? I don't know what you mean by "blood urea". Is there any chance you mean blood glucose also known as blood sugar? If so some questions that come to mind would be:Has your father been diagnosed with Type 2 diabetes? What treatments were prescribed? Did his doctor suggest diet and exercise?

An elevated BUN [blood urea nitrogen] is concern for liver and/or renal impairment, not diabetes. Although I have empathy for your father, you are seeking help in the wrong place. Ask your father's doctor to refer you to a nutritionist or some who specializes in that degree in your country.
